title: Save $206 on a Ryzen 7 5800XT, 32GB of DDR4 Corsair RAM, and an Asus ROG Strix B550-F Gaming motherboard with this combo start your AM4 PC for just $408
summary: Build a high-performance AM4 PC with a Ryzen 7 5800XT and Asus ROG Strix B550-F Gaming motherboard, paired with 32GB of DDR4 Corsair RAM, all for just $408.
insight: High-performance PC build at an affordable price point is available.

title: Nearly half of PC gamers prefer DLSS 4.5 over AMD's FSR and even native rendering Nvidia scores clean sweep in blind test of six titles
summary: Nvidia's DLSS 4.5 outperformed AMD's FSR and native rendering in a blind test, with 48.2% of votes. The test featured six different games, with users preferring the image quality of DLSS 4.5. Native rendering scored 24% and FSR 15% of the tally.
insight: Nvidia's AI-powered DLSS technology dominates in image quality blind test.

title: Over 80% of companies report no productivity gains from AI so far despite billions in investment, survey suggests 6,000 executives also reveal 1/3 of leaders use AI, but only for 90 minutes a week
summary: A survey of 6,000 executives finds 80% of companies report no AI productivity gains. Despite billions invested, a third of senior leaders use AI for only 1.5 hours a week.
insight: Leadership AI adoption and usage often lack strategic impact.

title: Elegoo Centauri Carbon 2 Review: A Four-Color Variant
summary: The Elegoo Centauri Carbon 2 is a four-color variant FDM 3D printer, offering enhanced color capabilities. It provides a more comprehensive and versatile printing experience for users. This printer is a significant upgrade from its predecessor.
insight: Elegoo's surprise upgrade transforms the Centauri series with color capabilities.

title: Lenovo denies allegations of transferring data to China class action lawsuit alleges company uses trackers to expose American behavioral data to foreign adversaries
summary: A class-action lawsuit alleges Lenovo transfers American data to Chinese servers, exposing behavioral data to foreign adversaries through website trackers.
insight: Lenovo's data collection practices raise US national security and privacy concerns

title: Data storage Guinness World Record broken by QR code pixels measuring just 49nm 1.98 sq micrometer size is smaller than bacteria, can only be read with an electron microscope
summary: A new Guinness World Record for the smallest QR code has been achieved, measuring 49nm in pixel size. This record was set by TU Wien and Cerabyte through a collaboration. The tiny QR code can only be read with an electron microscope.
insight: Advancements in nanotechnology enable secure, ultra-compact data storage solutions.

title: $1,000 bought an RTX 5080 in November 2025, now it only buys an RTX 5070 Ti report shows 15% average global price hike across Nvidia, AMD & Intel GPUs
summary: Nvidia's RTX 5090 is the most overpriced GPU globally, at 65% above MSRP. AMD's RX 9070 XT saw the smallest price hike of 7%. Global average GPU price hike is 15%.
insight: GPU price inflation significantly reduces purchasing power of consumers worldwide.

title: Meta will deploy standalone Nvidia Grace CPUs in production, with Vera to follow company sees perf-per-watt improvements of up to 2X in some CPU workloads
summary: Meta and Nvidia partner to deploy standalone Grace CPUs in production, aiming to boost performance-per-watt in specific workloads.
insight: Improved CPU efficiency in certain workloads with up to 2X power gains.

title: Dutch Secretary of Defense threatens to 'jailbreak' nation's F-35 jet fighters says it's just like jailbreaking an iPhone, in response to questions over software independence
summary: Dutch Secretary of Defense Gijs Tuinman compares 'jailbreaking' F-35 jets to iPhone modification, sparking speculation.
insight: European nations seek software independence for F-35 jets amidst US support uncertainty.

title: Phison CEO thinks NAND shortages could shut down entire consumer electronics companies in 2026 claims at least one foundry demands three-year cash payment upfront
summary: Phison CEO warns that NAND shortages could devastate consumer electronics companies in 2026 due to extreme supply chain demands.
insight: NAND supply chain instability threatens entire industries financially.

title: TerraMaster F2-425 Plus 3+2-bay hybrid NAS review Part 1: unboxing, teardown, drives installation, and first boot
summary: The TerraMaster F2-425 Plus 3+2-bay NAS is reviewed in its first part, focusing on unboxing, teardown, drive installation, and first boot experiences.
insight: In-depth review offers valuable insights into NAS hardware and setup process.

title: AsteroidOS 2.0 open-source smartwatch OS released, now supports around 30 devices
summary: AsteroidOS 2.0, a Linux-based open-source smartwatch OS, has been released with support for around 30 devices. The new version includes features such as always-on display, tilt-to-wake, and a customizable QuickPanel. It has been a decade since the project's inception, with significant improvements made over time.
insight: Open-source smartwatch OS gains momentum with improved features and support
